instructions: Open the Google Home app on your phone. In the Home View tab (left-most bottom tab, with the house icon), tap the device you want to link your account to. Tap the settings gear . Tap Link your account with Voice Match . Tap Signet Settings Link your account Source: Ara Wagoner / Android Central Tap I agree to start the Voice Match process. Say "OK Google" and "Hey Google" as prompted on screen. If you already have Voice Match set up from other devices, Google will hold on a loading screen as the voice model is generated for this Google Home. Tap I Agree to turn on personal results when speaking to Google Home. If you don't want personal results turned on, tap No Thanks instead. I agree OK Google I agree Source: Ara Wagoner / Android Central Google Assistant will ask you if you want to invite other people to set up Voice Match on the Google Home. Tap No Thanks . If this is your first Google Home device, you'll be asked if you want to add any media services. Tap the + next to a music service to link your subscription, or tap Next . If this is your first Google Home device, you'll be asked if you want to add any video services. Tap the + next to a video service to link your subscription, or tap Next . No Thanks Next Next Source: Ara Wagoner / Android Central If this is your first Google Home device, you'll be asked to opt-in to informational and promotional emails about Google Home, Chromecast, and other Google products. Tap Sign up to opt in or No thanks to opt out. Tap Done to complete setup. No thanks Done Finished! Source: Ara Wagoner / Android Central

On your phone, open the Google Home app. In the Home View tab (left-most bottom tab, with the house icon), tap Settings next to the Add shortcut. Tap Home members . Tap the + in the top right corner to add a new home member. Settings Home members Add Source: Ara Wagoner / Android Central Type the email account for the member you wish to add. Tap Save . An invite page will appear, telling you what home members can do and listing what devices they'll have access to. Tap More to scroll down. Scroll down to the bottom and hit Send invite . Email More Send invite Source: Ara Wagoner / Android Central

Open the Google Home app on the invitee's phone . In the Home View tab (left-most bottom tab, with the house icon), tap 1 pending invitation . An invite page will appear, telling the invitee what they'll be able to do and listing what devices they'll have access to. Tap More to scroll down. Scroll down to the bottom and hit Accept . 1 pending invitation More Accept Source: Ara Wagoner / Android Central Type a nickname for the home. Tap Next . Tap Next to set up Voice Match. Google will show you the various privacy and use policies involved with Google Assistant. Tap a section to read more, and when you're satisfied, tap Next . Name Next Next Source: Ara Wagoner / Android Central Scroll down and tap Turn on to allow this information, or No Thanks . You can get more in-depth answers and interactions by allowing Google Assistant access to device information and audio activity. Tap I Agree . Say "OK Google" and "Hey Google" as prompted on screen. If you already have Voice Match set up from other devices, Google will hold on a loading screen as the voice model is generated for this Google Home. Turn on I agree Setting up Voice Match Source: Ara Wagoner / Android Central Tap I Agree to turn on personal results when speaking to Google Home. If you don't want personal results turned on, tap No Thanks instead. Tap No Thanks when Google asks you if you want to invite other people to set up Voice Match on the Google Home. Tap the back button to go back to the Google Home setup. If this is your first Google Home device, return to Step 9 in the How to link your account to someone else's Google Home section . Otherwise, you're done! I agree No thanks You're done! Source: Ara Wagoner / Android Central

On your phone, open the Google Home app. In the Home View tab (left-most bottom tab, with the house icon), tap Settings next to the Add shortcut. Tap Home members . Tap the three-dot menu button next to the member you wish to remove. Settings Home members Menu Source: Ara Wagoner / Android Central Tap Remove . Tap Remove to confirm the removal. Remove Remove All gone Source: Ara Wagoner / Android Central
